ACT
144
Distribution of household items
Household items that are not of significant value, and serve to meet the daily needs of the heir who lived with the decedent in the same household, who is not his descendant or his spouse, will be left to him at his request, and their value will be included in part that heir.
If the value of the objects exceeds the value of the inherited part, the heir to whom these objects were left will pay this difference to the other heirs in money.
